sub_title: Student at Eindhoven University of Technology
summary: I am currently pursuing my masters in Automotive Technology from Eindhoven University of Technology. In addition, I am looking for an opportunity to use my knowledge and skills in a challenging environment with a passion to succeed in my ambition and build a successful career path in engineering. My interest in exploring machines since childhood garnered my path to obtain an engineering degree. My university experience, internship exposure and range of other activities have allowed me to gain a diversified experience and develop the skills that will assist me in fulfilling and completing any work put forth.

profile_positions.description:
Internship Project: Energy Management System Implementation using Optimal Control

Internship at the TU/e student automotive team, InMotion with their aim of designing, engineering and building a series-hybrid race car to participate in the 24 hours of Le Mans race.

•	Development of an energy management system (EMS) with the aim of minimizing fuel consumption whilst meeting power requirements of a series hybrid powertrain race car.
•	The software utilized was Matlab/Simulink.
•	Modelling of powertrain components using the QSS-Toolbox for quasi-static simulations.
•	Power flow analysis of various components (ICE-Gen set, Ultra-capacitors and Electric traction motor) based on a predefined drivecycle, followed by generating a framework for the energy management problem.
•	Designing and implementing the ECMS control strategy for optimizing the power flow.
•	In addition, an active aerodynamics system was developed and introduced in the original model.
•	The efficiency of the modified model (active aerodynamics) is verified by comparing and analyzing results with the original model, whereby the modified model achieved a better fuel consumption.
profile_positions.title: Student Internship

profile_positions.description:
Involved in the departments of workshop (passenger and commercial), customer care, spare parts and outstation.

Workshop:
•	Servicing and maintenance of vehicle involving engine oil, spark plugs, oil/fuel filters, etc.
•	Repair/overhaul of engine, gearbox, clutch, propeller shaft, fuel-injection pump and brake system.
•	Identifying reasons for delays in the workshop & providing solutions to speed up the service/repair.

Customer Care:
•	Dealing with customers directly and identifying various issues related to their vehicle.
•	Liaising with the workshop department by providing solutions to the issues and conveying the relevant information to the customer.

Spare Parts Division:
•	Studying the management of spare parts and recognizing its shortcomings related to any ambiguous placement of parts or inefficient distribution of parts.
•	Re-organizing the spare parts in an efficient way such that there is minimum time of supply to the workshop and other external customers. 

Outstation:
•	Attending the calls of customers and understanding the problems related to their vehicles.
•	Explaining the problems and solutions to the technician who is to be sent to the designated site, while keeping track of his progress.
profile_positions.title: Trainee Internship

profile_positions.description:
Internship project on the study and evaluation of energy efficiency and cost effective solutions for steel industries to control & reduce pollution. 

•	Assessment of currently installed Pollution Control System and identifying its shortcomings while providing detailed suggestions for its improvement. 
•	Producing reports at regular intervals to determine the progress.
•	Analyzing & finding cost-effective solutions to the matters arising.
profile_positions.title: Project Intern

profile_positions.description:
Project Assistant on the construction of a Vibro feeder and Pollution Control Device for Steel melting Furnace.  Supervised a group of workers and technicians, while submitting progress reports to the Project Director for:

•	Fabrication of Ducting and Chimney parts
•	Assembly, Rectification and installation of Vibro Feeder
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
Involved with the Engineers Without Borders (EWB) Sheffield branch. Projects associated with this branch include the wind turbine project, the water project and the pedal-powered machines project.

• Organizing training events in the form of talks, workshops, activities, seminars and other events that will provide society members with skills to make various projects successful.
• Communicating with professionals from various organizations and varied backgrounds.
• Making decisions regarding the grading & selection of people/organization; keeping a steady relationship with other organizations.

Part of a volunteering team in an Oxfam shop based in Sheffield.

• Sorting different types of goods (mainly clothes, books & household equipment) that are donated.
• Sourcing the goods that are to be placed on the shelf for sale.
• Assisting & dealing with customers while also handling the cash register.
• Providing advice and support to newer recruits while cooperating together as a team.
